glsa.title: Openswan: Insecure temporary file creation
glsa.synopsis: An insecure temporary file usage has been reported in Openswan, allowing for symlink attacks.

background.p: Openswan is an implementation of IPsec for Linux.

description.p: Dmitry E. Oboukhov reported that the IPSEC livetest tool does not handle the ipseclive.conn and ipsec.olts.remote.log temporary files securely.

impact.p: A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to execute arbitrary code and overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Openswan users should upgrade to the latest version:
